main event: A civilian traveling in a car observed a silver, highly polished, disc-shaped object flying at a high rate of speed about 200 feet above the ground in Huntsville, Ohio on June 11, 1949.
interesting points: The observer reported seeing fins or projections on the lower side of the object, similar to the appearance of a sea seal's flippers.
The object made a swift turn to the right and then flew northwest at a very high rate of speed, disappearing from view in just a few seconds.
No sound or odor was reported, and the witness felt duty-bound to report the sighting despite anxiety about others questioning his sanity.
The observer described the object's movements as similar to a puppet being guided on a string, indicating unusual maneuverability.
The bright, brilliant luminosity of the object was likened to a highly polished mirror and appeared to have no effect on the surrounding clouds.
sighted object: a silver, highly polished, disc-shaped object with fins or projections
